metadata.feature_description: Allows selection and configuration of Google Analytics account, web property, and data stream

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Load and display available Google Analytics accounts

steps.action: Navigate to Persona Bar > Settings > Connectors
Click Connect on Google Analytics 4 connector
steps.expected: OAuth authorization panel with 'Connect to GA' button should appear, followed by Account dropdown after authorization
steps.actual: Only basic Measurement ID field and Track for Administrators checkbox are displayed. No OAuth panel, no 'Connect to GA' button, no Account dropdown. The Evoq.Content.GoogleAnalyticsConnector with OAuth flow is NOT loaded.

issues: The OAuth-based Google Analytics connector (Evoq.Content.GoogleAnalyticsConnector) is NOT installed or NOT loading in the UI
Only a basic 'Google Analytics 4' connector exists with manual Measurement ID input
The authorize.js script and authroize.htm template from the code repository are not being loaded
No 'Connect to GA' button or OAuth authorization flow is available

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Select and change Google Analytics account

steps.action: Look for Account dropdown in Google Analytics connector
steps.expected: Account dropdown should be visible after OAuth authorization
steps.actual: No Account dropdown exists. Only Measurement ID text field is available.

issues: Account selection functionality is not available because OAuth connector is not loaded

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Load web properties for selected account

steps.expected: Web Properties dropdown should appear after selecting an account
steps.actual: No Web Properties dropdown exists in the UI

issues: Web property selection functionality is not available because OAuth connector is not loaded

steps.expected: Should be able to select from Web Properties dropdown

issues: Feature not available - OAuth connector not loaded

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Load data streams for selected property

steps.expected: Data Streams dropdown should appear after selecting a web property
steps.actual: No Data Streams dropdown exists in the UI

issues: Data stream selection functionality is not available because OAuth connector is not loaded

steps.expected: Should be able to select from Data Streams dropdown

issues: Feature not available - OAuth connector not loaded

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify tracking ID is correctly set after configuration

steps.action: Configure data stream and verify tracking ID auto-population
steps.expected: After selecting a data stream, the Measurement/Tracking ID should be automatically populated
steps.actual: Cannot test automatic population - OAuth connector not available. However, basic GA4 connector accepts manual Measurement ID entry.

steps.action: Enter manual Measurement ID 'G-TEST12345' and save
steps.actual: Manual Measurement ID was saved successfully with success message 'Item successfully saved'

issues: Automatic tracking ID population from OAuth flow is not available
Only manual Measurement ID entry is possible with the basic GA4 connector

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test configuration with multiple GA accounts

steps.action: Attempt to configure multiple Google Analytics accounts
steps.expected: Should be able to select from multiple GA accounts if user has access to more than one
steps.actual: Cannot test - no Account dropdown available, OAuth connector not loaded

issues: Multi-account configuration not testable - OAuth connector not available

observations: CRITICAL: The Evoq.Content.GoogleAnalyticsConnector with OAuth-based account configuration is NOT installed or NOT loading in this DNN instance
The UI shows only 'Google Analytics 4' connector which uses a different, simpler implementation (GoogleAnalytics4/scripts/connector.js)
The code for OAuth connector exists in repository at 'Evoq Enterprise/Connectors/GoogleAnalytics/' including authorize.js, authroize.htm, and ServicesController.cs
JavaScript evaluation confirmed: .connectPanel, .connectedPanel, and .loadingStatusPanel elements do NOT exist in the DOM
The basic GA4 connector provides only: Measurement ID text field, Track for Administrators checkbox, Cancel/Save/Delete buttons
Basic GA4 functionality works: Successfully tested entering Measurement ID, saving configuration, and deleting connection
The DNN manifest shows Evoq.Content.GoogleAnalyticsConnector depends on Evoq.GoogleAnalyticsConnector version 09.00.00 - this dependency may not be properly installed
